TITLE: Divisive social media star Andrew Tate detained in Romania in human trafficking case

It's especially beneficial for preterm and low birthweight babies. Andrew Caballero-Reynolds for NPR

TITLE: Europe bans Russian oil products, the latest strike on the Kremlin war chest
SUMMARY: Tires of a truck are pictured at a gas station in Frankfurt, Germany, Jan. 27. A European ban on imports of diesel fuel and other products made from crude oil in Russian refineries takes effect Feb. 5. The goal is to stop feeding Russia's war chest, but fuel costs have already jumped since the war started and they could rise again

TITLE: Shlomo Perel, a Holocaust survivor who inspired the film 'Europa Europa,' dies at 98
SUMMARY: This undated photo provided by Yad Vashem Holocaust Memorial shows Shlomo Perel at his home in Givatayim, Israel. Perel, who survived the Holocaust through surreal subterfuge and an extraordinary odyssey that inspired his own writing and an internationally renowned film, has died. He was 98. Yad Vashem Holocaust Memorial via AP

TITLE: The Pope has called for peace in South Sudan in the final part of his Africa tour
SUMMARY: Pope Francis arrives to celebrate mass at the John Garang Mausoleum in Juba, South Sudan, Sunday, Feb. 5, 2023. Francis is in South Sudan on the second leg of a six-day trip that started in Congo, hoping to bring comfort and encouragement to two countries that have been riven by poverty, conflicts and what he calls a "colonialist mentality" that has exploited Africa for centuries

TITLE: Latest on Ukraine: U.S. aid stumbles and Slovakia elects a pro-Russia leader
SUMMARY: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba (center left) and European Union foreign policy chief Josep Borrell visit a monument to fallen defenders of Ukraine in Kyiv, Monday. Borrell and EU foreign ministers have gathered in Kyiv in a display of support for Ukraine's fight against Russia's invasion. Press service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine via AP

TITLE: Worry and concern follow pro-Kremlin candidate's victory in Slovakia election
SUMMARY: Chairman of Smer party Robert Fico (center) addresses reporters in Bratislava, Slovakia, on Sunday

TITLE: A bus of tourists in Venice dropped from an elevated road, killing 21 in fiery crash
SUMMARY: Emergency services personnel work at the scene of a passenger bus crash that killed 21 people and injured at least 15 others in Venice, Italy, on Tuesday night. Slow Press/LiveMedia/LaPresse via AP

TITLE: Biden says he's worried about Ukraine aid. The Pentagon warns it's running low
SUMMARY: President Biden told reporters on Wednesday that he's worried about the fate of his $24 billion request for Ukraine aid

TITLE: Grenade fragments were found in bodies in Prigozhin's plane crash, Putin claims
SUMMARY: In this image taken from video, smoke rises from the crash of a private jet near the village of Kuzhenkino in the Tver region of Russia, on Aug. 23. Mercenary leader Yevgeny Prigozhin, head of the Wagner Group, and his top lieutenants were among the 10 people killed in the crash northwest of the Russian capital

TITLE: Russian strike kills dozens of Ukrainian civilians attending a wake, Zelenskyy says
SUMMARY: In this photo provided by the Ukrainian Presidential Press Office, emergency workers search the victims of the deadly Russian rocket attack that killed dozens of people in the village of Hroza near Kharkiv, Ukraine, Thursday, Oct. 5, 2023

TITLE: U.K. Supreme Court to weigh legality of plan to deport migrants to Rwanda
SUMMARY: People believed to be migrants walk in Dungeness, a headland on the coast of England, on Aug. 16

TITLE: It's a global climate solution — if it can get past conspiracy theories and NIMBYs
SUMMARY: Carlos Moreno, a Franco-Colombian urbanist, has been helping spread the idea of 15-minute cities — where people can access key things in their life within a short walk, bike ride or transit ride of their home. But the climate solution is seeing huge challenges, including conspiracy theories

TITLE: European leaders pledge support for Israel, condemn Hamas and halt Palestinian aid
SUMMARY: The Israeli flag will be projected onto the Brandenburg Gate on the sidelines of the Festival of Lights as a show of solidarity. Fabian Sommer/dpa/picture alliance/Getty Images

TITLE: After a ride went viral, a London cabbie offers some life lessons for the road
SUMMARY: Michael Son sits behind the wheel in his London cab, a job he's had since 1965

TITLE: England's beloved Sycamore Gap tree will be removed from Hadrian's Wall
SUMMARY: The massive trunk and crown of the Sycamore Gap tree will be moved from the spot where it fell along Hadrian's Wall in England's north east. Police have made two arrests in the felling of the historic tree. Jeff J Mitchell/Getty Images

TITLE: 'Walk the talk' or face fines: EU boss tells Musk, Zuckerberg and TikTok chief
SUMMARY: In a series of letters to tech executives, European Union Commissioner Thierry Breton warned that financial penalties could be issued against social media platforms that do not follow new EU laws governing hate speech and disinformation. Ludovic Marin/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: The Sunday Story: A 15-minute climate solution attracts conspiracies
SUMMARY: Michael Brilliot, deputy director for citywide planning for San Jose, Calif., is building urban villages — with a mix of apartments and amenities nearby. He says it's the city's version of 15-minute cities. Most of San Jose is dominated by single-family neighborhoods that aren't so dense

TITLE: Biden made promises to Israel and Ukraine. To keep his word, he needs Congress
SUMMARY: President Biden walks toward Marine One on the South Lawn of the White House on Fri., Oct. 13, 2023

TITLE: Polish opposition leader Tusk declares win as ruling conservatives lose majority
SUMMARY: Donald Tusk, a former Polish prime minister addresses supporters at his party headquarters in Warsaw, Poland, Sunday, Oct. 15, 2023

TITLE: Russia is scrapping its ratification of a key nuclear test ban. Here's what that means
SUMMARY: A Russian Yars ballistic missile mounted on a mobile launcher during a rehearsal for the Victory Day military parade in Red Square in 2018. Russia has refrained from testing its nuclear weapons since the 1990s

TITLE: Belgian police shoot dead suspected extremist accused of killing 2 Swedes in Brussels
SUMMARY: Police patrol outside the King Baudouin Stadium, after a match between Belgium and Sweden was suspended, after a shooting in the center of Brussels, Monday, Oct. 16, 2023

TITLE: Biden says his Tel Aviv trip was a gamble. Tonight, he has another high-stakes moment
SUMMARY: President Biden makes a rare appearance in the press cabin on Air Force One during his return from Tel Aviv to talk about a deal to get aid into Gaza through Egypt. Brendan Smialowski/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Russia charges Radio Free Europe editor with failing to register as a 'foreign agent'
SUMMARY: In this handout, Radio Free Europe-Radio Liberty editor Alsu Kurmasheva poses for a photo during a work break in Prague, Czech Republic, on March 6, 2013. Claire Bigg/Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty via AP

TITLE: The White House is asking for almost $106 billion for Israel, Ukraine and the border
SUMMARY: President Biden used an Oval Office address to make the case that funding for Israel and Ukraine is in the national interest. Jonathan Ernst/Pool/Reuters via Getty Images

TITLE: Gale-force winds and floods strike northern Europe, killing at least 3 in the U.K.
SUMMARY: People try to pump water away in a flooded neighborhood in Haderslev, Denmark, on Friday
